Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Location: Greater Chicago Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Job Title:  Senior Business Analyst, Global Solutions

 Business Unit:  Global Solutions Group

 Location:  Chicago

 Reports To:  Executive Director, Chief Solutions Officer

 Full Time/Part Time:  Full Time

 Hours  : 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.

Position Summary: 

R.J. O'Brien & Associates LLC is the oldest and largest independent futures brokerage and clearing firm in the United States. We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to partner with business leaders throughout the firm to understand how to bridge the gap between their needs and delivery of a technical solution. The job will include collection and analysis of business requirements as well as drafting of project proposals, business requirements and creation of functional specifications. The role will require interaction with business leaders, system users, internal development teams and external vendors. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 8 years experience working as a business analyst.

Duties & Responsibilities:

 Act as a consultant to senior management and all stakeholders who have a need for new or revised functionality  Collect, analyze, document, and review business requirements with project stakeholders  Create functional specifications and review them with development teams  Document and design business, data, process or workflows that show current and future flows  Review, analyze, and document changes to business processes that could benefit from improvements  Scope projects, create project plans and collaborate with developers to create work estimates and schedules  Organize meetings to track project status, manage deadlines and work with IT to meet project requirements  Help manage and provide governance for company project portfolio artifacts for project prioritization, decision making, resource management, communications, metrics and reporting  Assist in development of testing plans and scripts  Support end user testing  Help, plan and participate in testing and facilitate implementation  Manage, train and evaluate less experienced analysts 

 Qualifications: 

Demonstrated knowledge and provide examples of recent experience working as a Business Analyst and / or Project Manager in the brokerage industry for a sell side firm. Candidate should have a general sense of the trading, clearing cycle, risk and regulatory backdrop in the brokerage industry.

 Confidence in working with a diverse group of colleagues across multiple geographies and multiple levels  A collaborative approach to problem solving  Familiarity with elicitation skills to understand business processes and needs.  Ability to document business requirements.  Ability to translate business requirements to a clear and logical functional specification that is coherent to IT developers and QA  Understand key concepts and standard methods employed by BA and PM roles in an organization  Enthusiastic self-starter who takes initiative 

 SKILLS DESIRED: 

 Excellent interpersonal skills with a strong focus on internal client service  Experience in overseeing, directing, training and evaluating other business analysts  Able to produce clear system process and workflow diagrams  Familiarity and experience with various system development life cycle methodologies  Experience working for a brokerage firm  Demonstrate familiarity with business systems and process flows within the brokerage industry (front, middle or back office) 

It is the policy of R.J. O’Brien & Associates, LLC to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
